pr_title: CAMEL-14626 : api maven plugin - Cannot load <T> class

timeline.message: CAMEL-14626 : api maven plugin - Cannot load <T> class

timeline.bodyText: Could also do it at line 335, but I think this approach is more universal.
timeline.author: manonthegithub

timeline.bodyText: @manonthegithub I'm not sure, but we could try to implement more elegant solution, like cast to (T) and catch ClassCastException?
timeline.author: dmvolod

replies.bodyText: @dmvolod it is already checked that the clas does not exits on the line 335 and then 344, how would additional check help?
replies.author: manonthegithub

replies.bodyText: Didn't do much of class casting, but I think it's impossible to cast having only string value of a class name.
replies.author: manonthegithub

replies.bodyText: I mean a String in runtime with the name of type arg
replies.author: manonthegithub

replies.bodyText: Yes, you are right, but looks like not handles all generics variants. But may be it's enough for current cases.
replies.author: dmvolod

replies.bodyText: That is true, but it's not really possible to distinguish here between Generic parameter and nonexistent class.
replies.author: manonthegithub

timeline.message: improved parser to handle multiple generic args, fixed ignoring
